Why CMMS & PdM?

  • Prevent untimely breakdowns
  • Reduce maintenance oversight
  • Consistently operate at
    full capacity

  • Increase profits
  • Learn more...

Davison Maintenance CMMS

Davison Maintenance CMMS is a fast, affordable, customizable, and self-contained Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) developed by Paul Davison.

Use it to make informed decisions about work done by personnel on equipment and other facility assets. Maintain an inventory of parts used from work orders and report maintenance costs and down time. Learn more...

PredictMate ®

PredictMATE works with any CMMS or runs stand-alone as a valuable tool help your company avoid costly equipment failure.

Readings are entered manually, imported from handheld devices, imported from external data files, or imported from SCADA. Enter almost any type of reading to PredictMATE, such as vibration, amperage, cycles, or runtime hours. Learn more...

Home

Why Choose Davison Software?

If you're being told to pay tens of thousands of dollars for a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS), perhaps that's too much. And rethink whether you need Enterprise Asset Management (EAM). EAM could lead you to unnecessary, and inflated software support costs.

Save time and money by getting a system that meets your requirements, not exceeds them. Simple management of workflow and preventive maintenance will reduce your downtime and costs. Davison Software can help define your reporting requirements before you purchase anything, not after you've committed to a software agreement.

Some of us like to impress our maintenance management friends with acronyms like Service Lifecycle Management (SLM), or Overall Asset Productivity (OAP). We think that perhaps by watching Key Performance Indicators (KPI) alone, we would resolve our maintenance issues. Preoccupation with this management knowledge can lead us away from our basic requirements. You may only need to:

  • Manage the people who perform maintenance.
  • Control costs and manage inventory requisition.
  • Fulfill the reporting requirements of your organization.

Hands-On Experience

Paul Davison started hands-on in maintenance management as a certified operator and plant manager for water treatment. He has worked for engineering and contract operations firms as a technician, operations coordinator, and trainer. He also has years of full-time experience in programming enterprise databases for a large corporation.

Paul has supported and developed computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS) since 1986.
